docs.text:
An array of hashtables for devices to be created. Available parameters can be found at https://docs.venafi.com/Docs/current/TopNav/Content/SDK/WebSDK/r-SDK-POST-Certificates-request.php. If provisioning applications as well, those should be provided with the Application parameter.

Type: Hashtable[]
Parameter Sets: ByName
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Type: Hashtable[]
Parameter Sets: ByNameWithDevice
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Application
docs.text:
An array of hashtables for applications to be created. Available parameters can be found at https://docs.venafi.com/Docs/current/TopNav/Content/SDK/WebSDK/r-SDK-POST-Certificates-request-ApplicationsParameter.php. In addition to the application parameters, a key/value must be provided for the associated device. The key needs to be 'DeviceName' and the value is the ObjectName from the device. See the example.

Type: Hashtable[]
Parameter Sets: ByNameWithDevice
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -TimeoutSec
docs.text:
Control the wait time, in seconds, for a CA to issue/renew a certificate. Can be set globally in the product, https://docs.venafi.com/Docs/currentSDK/TopNav/Content/SDK/WebSDK/r-SDK-Certificates-API-settings.php. Use this as an override to the global setting. The product default of 0 will cause this function to return immediately, before the certificate has been created. This property is useful if you are wanting to immediately access the certificate when New-VdcCertificate is finished, eg. to pipe to Export-VdcCertificate.

Type: Int32
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases: WorkToDoTimeout

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: 0
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Create new custom field in Venafi of the specified class and type.

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
New-VdcCustomField [-Name] <String> [-Label] <String> [-Class] <String[]> [-Type] <String>
 [[-AllowedValue] <String[]>] [-Single] [[-Help] <String>] [[-ErrorMessage] <String>] [-Mandatory]
 [-Policyable] [[-RegEx] <String>] [-RenderHidden] [-RenderReadOnly] [-DateOnly] [-TimeOnly] [-PassThru]
 [[-VenafiSession] <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Creates a new custom field in Venafi. Required parameters are name, label, class and type. See Venafi docs for information about other metadata items.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
New-VdcCustomField -Name "Last Date" -Label "Last Date" -Class "X509 Certificate" -Type "String" -RenderReadOnly -Help "Last Date of certificate import"
Create new custom field for certificates

docs.title: -Name
docs.text:
Name of new custom field

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Label
docs.text:
Label of new custom field

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 2
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Class
docs.text:
Class of new custom field, either 'Device' or 'X509 Certificate'

Type: String[]
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 3
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Type

Type of new custom field, one of 'String', 'List', 'DateTime', 'Identity'

Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 4
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 5
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.text:
Controls the number of input selections. If not used the user can select multiple values for the Custom Field. Otherwise the user can select only one value

Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Aliases:

Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.text:
New-VdcObject -Path <String> [-SourcePath <String>] [-PushCertificate] [-Force] [-PassThru]
 [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Generic use function to create a new object if a specific function hasn't been created yet for the class. This can also be used to duplicate an existing object.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
New-VdcObject -Path '\VED\Policy\Test Device' -Class 'Device' -Attribute @{'Description'='new device testing'}

Create a new object

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
New-VdcObject -Path 'missing\folder\again' -Class 'Policy' -Force

Create a new object as well as any missing policy folders in the path

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
New-VdcObject -Path '\VED\Policy\Test Device' -Class 'Device' -Attribute @{'Description'='new device testing'} -PassThru

Create a new object and return the resultant object

docs.title: EXAMPLE 4
docs.text:
New-VdcObject -Path '\VED\Policy\Test Device\App' -Class 'Basic' -Attribute @{'Driver Name'='appbasic';'Certificate'='\Ved\Policy\mycert.com'}

Create a new Basic application and associate it to a device and certificate

docs.title: EXAMPLE 5
docs.text:
New-VdcObject -Path 'certificates\duplicate.company.com' -SourcePath 'certificates\original.company.com'

Create a duplicate object with all attributes from the original being copied over

docs.title: -Path
docs.text:
Full path, including name, for the object to be created. If the root path is excluded, \ved\policy will be prepended.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Class
docs.text:
Class name of the new object. See https://docs.venafi.com/Docs/current/TopNav/Content/SDK/WebSDK/SchemaReference/r-SDK-CNattributesWhere.php for more info.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: NonDup
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Attribute
docs.text:
Hashtable with initial values for the new object. These will be specific to the object class being created.

Type: Hashtable
Parameter Sets: NonDup
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -SourcePath
docs.text:
Provide this path when you want to duplicate an existing object. This will be the path of the source object and Path will be the destination. All attributes which have been set on this object will be copied to the new one. Retrieving all existing attributes will take some time.

Not recommended for duplicating certificates.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: Dup
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -PushCertificate
docs.text:
If creating an application object, you can optionally push the certificate once the creation is complete. Only available if a 'Certificate' key containing the certificate path is provided for Attribute.

Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Add a new policy folder

docs.title: NameWithPolicyAttribute
docs.text:
New-VdcPolicy -Path <String> -Name <String[]> -Attribute <Hashtable> -Class <String> [-Lock] [-Force]
 [-PassThru] [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: PathWithPolicyAttribute
docs.text:
New-VdcPolicy -Path <String> -Attribute <Hashtable> -Class <String> [-Lock] [-Force] [-PassThru]
 [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: Name
docs.text:
New-VdcPolicy -Path <String> -Name <String[]> [-Description <String>] [-Attribute <Hashtable>] [-Force]
 [-PassThru] [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: Path
docs.text:
New-VdcPolicy -Path <String> [-Description <String>] [-Attribute <Hashtable>] [-Force] [-PassThru]
 [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Add a new policy folder(s). Add object attributes or policy attributes at the same time.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
$newPolicy = New-VdcPolicy -Path 'new'

Create a new policy folder

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
$newPolicy = New-VdcPolicy -Path 'existing' -Name 'new1', 'new2', 'new3'

Create multiple policy folders

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
$newPolicy = New-VdcPolicy -Path 'new1\new2\new3' -Force

Create a new policy folder named new3 and create new1 and new2 if they do not exist

docs.title: EXAMPLE 4
docs.text:
$newPolicy = New-VdcPolicy -Path 'new' -Attribute {'Description'='my new policy folder'}

Create a new policy folder setting attributes on the object at creation time

docs.title: EXAMPLE 5
docs.text:
$newPolicy = New-VdcPolicy -Path 'new' -Class 'X509 Certificate' -Attribute {'State'='UT'}

Create a new policy folder setting policy attributes (not object attributes)

docs.title: EXAMPLE 6
docs.text:
$newPolicy = New-VdcPolicy -Path 'new' -Class 'X509 Certificate' -Attribute {'State'='UT'} -Lock

Create a new policy folder setting policy attributes (not object attributes) and locking them

docs.title: EXAMPLE 7
docs.text:
$newPolicy = New-VdcPolicy -Path 'new' -PassThru

Create a new policy folder returning the policy object created

docs.title: -Path
docs.text:
Full path to the new policy folder. If the root path is excluded, \ved\policy will be prepended. If used with -Name, this will be the root path and subfolders will be created.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName)
Accept wildcard characters: False

Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Aliases:

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Create a new team

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
New-VdcTeam [-Name] <String> [-Owner] <String[]> [-Member] <String[]> [[-Policy] <String[]>]
 [-Product] <String[]> [[-Description] <String>] [-PassThru] [[-VenafiSession] <PSObject>]
 [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Create a new TLSPDC team

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
New-VdcTeam -Name 'My New Team' -Member 'local:{803f332e-7576-4696-a5a2-8ac6be6b14e6}' -Owner 'local:{803f332e-7576-4696-a5a2-8ac6be6b14e7}' -Product 'TLS'

Create a new team

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
New-VdcTeam -Name 'My New Team' -Member 'local:{803f332e-7576-4696-a5a2-8ac6be6b14e6}' -Owner 'local:{803f332e-7576-4696-a5a2-8ac6be6b14e7}' -Product 'TLS' -Policy '\ved\policy\myfolder'

Create a new team and assign it to a policy

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
New-VdcTeam -Name 'My New Team' -Member 'local:{803f332e-7576-4696-a5a2-8ac6be6b14e6}' -Owner 'local:{803f332e-7576-4696-a5a2-8ac6be6b14e7}' -Product 'TLS' -Description 'One amazing team'

Create a new team with optional description

docs.title: EXAMPLE 4
docs.text:
New-VdcTeam -Name 'My New Team' -Member 'local:{803f332e-7576-4696-a5a2-8ac6be6b14e6}' -Owner 'local:{803f332e-7576-4696-a5a2-8ac6be6b14e7}' -Product 'TLS' -PassThru

Name : My New Team ID : local:{a6053090-e309-49d9-98a7-28cbe7896c27} Path : \VED\Identity\My New Team FullName : local:My New Team IsGroup : True Members : @{Name=sample-user; ID=local:{6baad36c-7cac-48c8-8e54-000cc22ad88f}; Path=\VED\Identity\sample-user; FullName=local:sample-user; IsGroup=False} Owners : @{Name=sample-owner; ID=local:{d1a76bc7-d3a6-431b-9bea-d2d8780ecd86}; Path=\VED\Identity\sample-owner; FullName=local:sample-owner; IsGroup=False}

Create a new team returning the new team

docs.text: Get a new access token or refresh an existing one

docs.title: Integrated (Default)

New-VdcToken -AuthServer <String> -ClientId <String> -Scope <Hashtable> [-State <String>]
 [-SkipCertificateCheck] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.text:
New-VdcToken -AuthServer <String> -ClientId <String> -RefreshToken <PSObject> [-SkipCertificateCheck]
 [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: Jwt
docs.text:
New-VdcToken -AuthServer <String> -ClientId <String> -Scope <Hashtable> -Jwt <String> [-SkipCertificateCheck]
 [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.text:
New-VdcToken -AuthServer <String> -ClientId <String> -Scope <Hashtable> -Certificate <X509Certificate>
 [-SkipCertificateCheck] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: OAuth
docs.text:
New-VdcToken -AuthServer <String> -ClientId <String> -Scope <Hashtable> -Credential <PSCredential>
 [-State <String>] [-SkipCertificateCheck] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: RefreshSession
docs.text:
New-VdcToken [-SkipCertificateCheck] -VenafiSession <PSObject> [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf]
 [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Get an access token and refresh token (if enabled) to be used with New-VenafiSession or other scripts/utilities that take such a token. You can also refresh an existing access token if you have the associated refresh token. Authentication can be provided as integrated, credential, or certificate.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
New-VdcToken -AuthServer 'https://mytppserver.example.com' -Scope @{ Certificate = "manage,discover"; Configuration = "manage" } -ClientId 'MyAppId' -Credential $credential
Get a new token with OAuth

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
New-VdcToken -AuthServer 'mytppserver.example.com' -Scope @{ Certificate = "manage,discover"; Configuration = "manage" } -ClientId 'MyAppId'
Get a new token with Integrated authentication

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
New-VdcToken -AuthServer 'mytppserver.example.com' -Scope @{ Certificate = "manage,discover"; Configuration = "manage" } -ClientId 'MyAppId' -Certificate $cert
Get a new token with certificate authentication

docs.title: EXAMPLE 4
docs.text:
New-VdcToken -AuthServer 'mytppserver.example.com' -ClientId 'MyApp' -RefreshToken $refreshCred
Refresh an existing access token by providing the refresh token directly

docs.title: EXAMPLE 5
docs.text:
New-VdcToken -VenafiSession $mySession
Refresh an existing access token by providing a VenafiSession object

docs.title: -AuthServer
docs.text:
Auth server or url, eg. venafi.company.com

Type: String
Parameter Sets: Integrated, RefreshToken, Jwt, Certificate, OAuth
Aliases: Server

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -ClientId
docs.text:
Application/integration ID configured in Venafi for token-based authentication. Case sensitive.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: Integrated, RefreshToken, Jwt, Certificate, OAuth
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Scope
docs.text:
Hashtable with Scopes and privilege restrictions. The key is the scope and the value is one or more privilege restrictions separated by commas. A privilege restriction of none or read, use a value of $null. Scopes include Agent, Certificate, Code Signing, Configuration, Restricted, Security, SSH, and statistics. See https://docs.venafi.com/Docs/current/TopNav/Content/SDK/AuthSDK/r-SDKa-OAuthScopePrivilegeMapping.php Using a scope of {'all'='core'} will set all scopes except for admin. Using a scope of {'all'='admin'} will set all scopes including admin. Usage of the 'all' scope is not suggested for production.

Type: Hashtable
Parameter Sets: Integrated, Jwt, Certificate, OAuth
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Authenticate a user and create a new session with which future calls can be made. Key based username/password and windows integrated are supported as well as token-based integrated, oauth, and certificate. By default, a session variable will be created and automatically used with other functions unless -PassThru is used. Tokens and TLSPC keys can be saved in a vault for future calls.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
New-VenafiSession -Server venafi.mycompany.com -ClientId VenafiPS-MyApp -Scope @{'certificate'='manage'}

Create token-based session using Windows Integrated authentication with a certain scope and privilege restriction

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
New-VenafiSession -Server venafi.mycompany.com -Credential $cred -ClientId VenafiPS-MyApp -Scope @{'certificate'='manage'}

Create token-based session

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
New-VenafiSession -Server venafi.mycompany.com -Certificate $myCert -ClientId VenafiPS-MyApp -Scope @{'certificate'='manage'}

Create token-based session using a client certificate

docs.title: EXAMPLE 4
docs.text:
New-VenafiSession -Server venafi.mycompany.com -AuthServer tppauth.mycompany.com -ClientId VenafiPS-MyApp -Credential $cred

Create token-based session using oauth authentication where the vedauth and vedsdk are hosted on different servers

docs.title: EXAMPLE 5
docs.text:
$sess = New-VenafiSession -Server venafi.mycompany.com -Credential $cred -PassThru

Create session and return the session object instead of setting to script scope variable

docs.title: EXAMPLE 6
docs.text:
New-VenafiSession -Server venafi.mycompany.com -AccessToken $accessCred

Create session using an access token obtained outside this module

docs.title: EXAMPLE 7
docs.text:
New-VenafiSession -Server venafi.mycompany.com -RefreshToken $refreshCred -ClientId VenafiPS-MyApp

Create session using a refresh token

docs.title: EXAMPLE 8
docs.text:
New-VenafiSession -Server venafi.mycompany.com -RefreshToken $refreshCred -ClientId VenafiPS-MyApp -VaultRefreshTokenName TppRefresh

Create session using a refresh token and store the newly created refresh token in the vault

docs.title: EXAMPLE 9
docs.text:
New-VenafiSession -VcKey $cred

Create session against TLSPC

docs.title: EXAMPLE 10
docs.text:
New-VenafiSession -VcKey $cred -VcRegion 'eu'

Create session against TLSPC in EU region

docs.title: EXAMPLE 11
docs.text:
New-VenafiSession -VaultVcKeyName vaas-key

Create session against TLSPC with a key stored in a vault

docs.title: -Scope
docs.text:
Hashtable with Scopes and privilege restrictions. The key is the scope and the value is one or more privilege restrictions separated by commas, @{'certificate'='delete,manage'}. Scopes include Agent, Certificate, Code Signing, Configuration, Restricted, Security, SSH, and statistics. For no privilege restriction or read access, use a value of $null. For a scope to privilege mapping, see https://docs.venafi.com/Docs/current/TopNav/Content/SDK/AuthSDK/r-SDKa-OAuthScopePrivilegeMapping.php Using a scope of {'all'='core'} will set all scopes except for admin. Using a scope of {'all'='admin'} will set all scopes including admin. Usage of the 'all' scope is not suggested for production.

Type: Hashtable
Parameter Sets: VaultRefreshToken, VaultAccessToken
Aliases:

Required: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Remove a cloud keystore

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Remove a certificate

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
Remove-VdcCertificate [-Path] <String> [-KeepAssociatedApps] [[-ThrottleLimit] <Int32>]
 [[-VenafiSession] <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Removes a Certificate object, all associated objects including pending workflow tickets, and the corresponding Secret Store vault information. You must either be a Master Admin or have Delete permission to the objects and have certificate:delete token scope. Run this in parallel with PowerShell v7+ when you have a large number to process.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
$cert | Remove-VdcCertificate
Remove a certificate via pipeline

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Remove-VdcCertificate -Path '\ved\policy\my cert'
Remove a certificate and any associated app

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Remove-VdcCertificate -Path '\ved\policy\my cert' -KeepAssociatedApps
Remove a certificate and first remove all associations, keeping the apps

docs.text:
Path to the certificate to remove

Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases: DN, CertificateDN

Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

 [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Dissociates one or more Application objects from an existing certificate. Optionally, you can remove the application objects and corresponding orphaned device objects that no longer have any applications

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:

Remove a single application object association

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Remove-VdcCertificateAssociation -Path '\ved\policy\my cert' -ApplicationPath '\ved\policy\my capi' -OrphanCleanup
Disassociate and delete the application object

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Remove-VdcCertificateAssociation -Path '\ved\policy\my cert' -RemoveAll
Remove all certificate associations

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Remove TLSPDC processing engine assignment(s) from policy folder(s)

docs.title: Matrix
docs.text:
Remove-VdcEngineFolder -FolderPath <String[]> -EnginePath <String[]> [-VenafiSession <PSObject>]
 [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: AllEngines
docs.text:
Remove-VdcEngineFolder -FolderPath <String[]> [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>]
 [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: AllFolders
docs.text:
Remove-VdcEngineFolder -EnginePath <String[]> [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>]
 [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text:
Remove TLSPDC processing engine assignment(s) from policy folder(s).

If you do not supply a list of TLSPDC processing engines, then all processing engines will be removed from the supplied list of policy folders.

If you do not supply a list of policy folders, then all policy folder assignments will be removed from the supplied list of processing engines.

Supplying both a list of policy folders and processing engines will result in the removal of the specified engines from the list of policy folders.

Errors due to a policy engine not being assigned to the listed policy folder are ignored.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Remove-VdcEngineFolder -FolderPath '\VED\Policy\Certificates\Web Team' -EnginePath @('\VED\Engines\MYVENAFI01','\VED\Engines\MYVENAFI02')
Remove policy folder '\VED\Policy\Certificates\Web Team' from the processing engines MYVENAFI01 and MYVENAFI02.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Remove-VdcEngineFolder -FolderPath @('\VED\Policy\Certificates\Web Team','\VED\Policy\Certificates\Database Team')
Remove all processing engine assignments for the policy folders '\VED\Policy\Certificates\Web Team' and '\VED\Policy\Certificates\Database Team'.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Remove-VdcEngineFolder -EnginePath @('\VED\Engines\MYVENAFI01','\VED\Engines\MYVENAFI02') -Confirm:$false
Removed all policy folder assignments from the processing engines MYVENAFI01 and MYVENAFI02. Suppress the confirmation prompt.

Type: String[]
Parameter Sets: Matrix, AllEngines

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Remove TLSPDC objects

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
Remove-VdcObject [-Path] <String> [-Recursive] [[-ThrottleLimit] <Int32>] [[-VenafiSession] <PSObject>]
 [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Remove a TLSPDC object and optionally perform a recursive removal. This process can be very destructive as it will remove anything you send it!!! Run this in parallel with PowerShell v7+ when you have a large number to process.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Remove-VdcObject -Path '\VED\Policy\My empty folder'
Remove an object

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Remove-VdcObject -Path '\VED\Policy\folder' -Recursive
Remove an object and all objects contained

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Find-VdcObject -Class 'capi' | Remove-VdcObject
Find 1 or more objects and remove them

docs.title: EXAMPLE 4
docs.text:
Remove-VdcObject -Path '\VED\Policy\folder' -Confirm:$false
Remove an object without prompting for confirmation.  Be careful!

docs.text:

Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.text: Revoke all grants for a specific user

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
Revoke-VdcGrant [[-ID] <String[]>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Revoke all grants for a specific user. You must either be an administrator or oauth administrator to perform this action. Also, your token must have the admin:delete scope. Available in TLSPDC v22.3 and later.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Revoke-VdcGrant -ID local:{9e9db8d6-234a-409c-8299-e3b81ce2f916}

Revoke all grants for a user

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Get-VdcIdentity -ID me@x.com | Revoke-VdcGrant

Revoke all grants getting universal id from other identity functions

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Revoke a token

docs.title: Session (Default)

Revoke-VdcToken [-Force] [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: AccessToken
docs.text:
Revoke-VdcToken -AuthServer <String> -AccessToken <PSObject> [-Force] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>]
 [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: VenafiPsToken
docs.text:
Revoke-VdcToken -VenafiPsToken <PSObject> [-Force] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Revoke a token and invalidate the refresh token if provided/available. This could be an access token retrieved from this module or from other means.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Revoke-VdcToken
Revoke token stored in session variable $VenafiSession from New-VenafiSession

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Revoke-VdcToken -Force
Revoke token bypassing confirmation prompt

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Revoke-VdcToken -AuthServer venafi.company.com -AccessToken $cred
Revoke a token obtained from TLSPDC, not necessarily via VenafiPS

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Search TLSPDC history for items with specific attributes

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
Search-VdcHistory [[-Path] <String>] [-Attribute] <Hashtable> [[-VenafiSession] <PSObject>]
 [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Items in the secret store matching the key/value provided will be found and their details returned with their associated 'current' item. As this function may return details on many items, optional parallel processing has been implemented. Be sure to use PowerShell v7+ to take advantage.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Search-VdcHistory -Attribute @{'ValidTo' = (Get-Date)}

Name : test.gdb.com TypeName : X509 Server Certificate Path : \VED\Policy\Certificates\test.gdb.com History : {@{AIACAIssuerURL=System.Object[]; AIAKeyIdentifier=F2E970BA11A64D616E78592911D7CC; C=US; CDPURI=0::False; EnhancedKeyUsage=Server Authentication(1.3.6.1.5.5.7.3.1).........}}

Find historical items that are still active

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Search-VdcHistory -Attribute @{'ValidTo' = (Get-Date)} -Path '\ved\policy\certs'

Find historical items that are still active and the current item starts with a specific path

docs.title: -Path
docs.text:
Starting path to associated current items to limit the search. The default is \VED\Policy.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: 1
Default value: \VED\Policy
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Attribute
docs.text:
Name and value to search. See https://docs.venafi.com/Docs/current/TopNav/Content/SDK/WebSDK/r-SDK-POST-Secretstore-lookupbyassociation.php for more details. Note, ValidFrom will perform a greater than or equal comparison and ValidTo will perform a less than or equal comparison. Currently, one 1 name/value pair can be used.

Type: Hashtable
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 2
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.text:

 [[-IssuingTemplate] <String[]>] [-NoOverwrite] [-PassThru] [[-VenafiSession] <PSObject>]
 [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

Set-VcApplication -ID 'MyApp' -TeamOwner 'GreatTeam'

Change the owner to this team

Set-VcApplication -ID 'MyApp' -TeamOwner 'GreatTeam' -NoOverwrite

docs.title: Application (Default)
docs.text:
Set-VcCertificate -Certificate <String> -Application <String[]> [-NoOverwrite] [-PassThru]
 [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: Tag
docs.text:
Set-VcCertificate -Certificate <String> -Tag <String[]> [-NoOverwrite] [-PassThru] [-VenafiSession <PSObject>]
 [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Associate one or more certificates with one or more applications or tags. The associated applications/tags can either replace or be added to existing. By default, applications/tags will be replaced.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Add-VcCertificateAssociation -Certificate '7ac56ec0-2017-11ee-9417-a17dd25b82f9' -Application '96fc9310-67ec-11eb-a8a7-794fe75a8e6f'

Associate a certificate to an application

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Add-VcCertificateAssociation -Certificate '7ac56ec0-2017-11ee-9417-a17dd25b82f9' -Application '96fc9310-67ec-11eb-a8a7-794fe75a8e6f', 'a05013bd-921d-440c-bc22-c9ead5c8d548'

Associate a certificate to multiple applications

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Find-VcCertificate -First 5 | Add-VcCertificateAssociation -Application 'My Awesome App'

Associate multiple certificates to 1 application by name

docs.title: EXAMPLE 4
docs.text:
Add-VcCertificateAssociation -Certificate '7ac56ec0-2017-11ee-9417-a17dd25b82f9' -Tag 'MyTagName'

Associate a certificate to a tag

docs.title: EXAMPLE 5
docs.text:
Add-VcCertificateAssociation -Certificate '7ac56ec0-2017-11ee-9417-a17dd25b82f9' -Tag 'MyTagName:MyTagValue'

Associate a certificate to a tag name/value pair

docs.title: EXAMPLE 6
docs.text:
Add-VcCertificateAssociation -Certificate '7ac56ec0-2017-11ee-9417-a17dd25b82f9' -Tag 'Tag1', 'MyTagName:MyTagValue'

Associate a certificate to multiple tags

docs.title: EXAMPLE 7
docs.text:
Add-VcCertificateAssociation -Certificate 'www.barron.com' -Application '96fc9310-67ec-11eb-a8a7-794fe75a8e6f' -NoOverwrite

Associate a certificate, by name, to an additonal application, keeping the existing application in place

docs.title: -Certificate
docs.text:
Certificate ID or name to be associated. If a name is provided and multiple certificates are found, they will all be associated. Tab completion can be used for a list of certificate names to choose from. Type 3 or more characters for tab completion to work.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases: certificateID

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Application
docs.text:
One or more application IDs or names. Tab completion can be used for a list of application names.

Type: String[]
Parameter Sets: Application
Aliases: applicationID

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Tag
docs.text:
One of more tag names or name/value pairs. To specify a name/value pair, use the format 'name:value'.

Type: String[]
Parameter Sets: Tag
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Append to existing as opposed to overwriting

Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Aliases:

Required: False

Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Update an existing application

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
Set-VcCertificateRequest -ID <String> [-Approve] [-RejectReason <String>] [-Wait] [-PassThru]
 [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Update details of existing applications. Additional properties will be available in the future.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Set-VcCertificateRequest -ID 'ca7ff555-88d2-4bfc-9efa-2630ac44c1f2' -Approve

Approve a request

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Set-VcCertificateRequest -ID 'ca7ff555-88d2-4bfc-9efa-2630ac44c1f2' -Approve:$false

Reject a request

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Set-VcCertificateRequest -ID 'ca7ff555-88d2-4bfc-9efa-2630ac44c1f2' -Approve:$false -RejectReason 'not needed'

Reject a request with a specific reason

docs.title: EXAMPLE 4
docs.text:
Set-VcCertificateRequest -ID 'ca7ff555-88d2-4bfc-9efa-2630ac44c1f2' -Approve -Wait

Approve a request and wait for the certificate request to finish processing

docs.title: EXAMPLE 5
docs.text:
Set-VcCertificateRequest -ID 'ca7ff555-88d2-4bfc-9efa-2630ac44c1f2' -Approve -Wait -PassThru

Approve a request and wait for the certificate request to finish processing. Once finished, return the resulting object which contains the newly created certificate details.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 6
docs.text:
Find-VcCertificateRequest -Status PENDING_APPROVAL | Set-VcCertificateRequest -Approve

Get all requests pending approval and approve them all. Use the Find filter to narrow the scope of requests found.

Aliases: certificateRequestId

Accept wildcard characters: False

Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Update an existing connector

docs.title: Manifest (Default)
docs.text:
Set-VcConnector -ManifestPath <String> [-ID <String>] [-VenafiSession <PSObject>]
 [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: Disable
docs.text:
Set-VcConnector -ID <String> [-Disable] [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>]
 [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Update a new machine, CA, TPP, or credential connector. You can either update the manifest or disable/reenable it.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Set-VcConnector -ManifestPath '/tmp/manifest_v2.json'

Update an existing connector with the same name as in the manifest

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Set-VcConnector -ID 'ca7ff555-88d2-4bfc-9efa-2630ac44c1f2' -ManifestPath '/tmp/manifest_v2.json'

Update an existing connector utilizing a specific connector ID

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Set-VcConnector -ID 'ca7ff555-88d2-4bfc-9efa-2630ac44c1f2' -Disable

Disable a connector

docs.title: EXAMPLE 4
docs.text:
Get-VcConnector -ID 'My connector' | Set-VcConnector -Disable

Disable a connector by name

docs.title: EXAMPLE 5
docs.text:
Set-VcConnector -ID 'ca7ff555-88d2-4bfc-9efa-2630ac44c1f2' -Disable:$false

Reenable a disabled connector

docs.title: -ManifestPath
docs.text:
Path to an updated manifest for an existing connector. Ensure the manifest has the deployment element which is not needed when testing in the simulator. See https://github.com/Venafi/vmware-avi-connector?tab=readme-ov-file#manifest for details.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: Manifest
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -ID
docs.text:
Connector ID to update. If not provided, the ID will be looked up by the name in the manifest provided by ManifestPath. Note that if both ManifestPath and ID are provided and the name in the manifest is different than the one associated with ID, the name will be changed.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: Manifest
Aliases: connectorId, connector

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName)
Accept wildcard characters: False

Type: String
Parameter Sets: Disable
Aliases: connectorId, connector

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName)

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Update an existing team

docs.title: NoOverwrite (Default)
docs.text:
Set-VcTeam -Team <String> [-Name <String>] [-Role <String>] [-UserMatchingRule <Hashtable[]>] [-PassThru]
 [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: Overwrite
docs.text:
Set-VcTeam -Team <String> [-Name <String>] [-Role <String>] -UserMatchingRule <Hashtable[]> [-NoOverwrite]
 [-PassThru] [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Update name, role, and/or user matching rules for existing teams.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Set-VcTeam -ID 'MyTeam' -Name 'ThisTeamIsBetter'

Rename an existing team

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Set-VcTeam -ID 'ca7ff555-88d2-4bfc-9efa-2630ac44c1f2' -Role 'PKI Admin'

Change the role for an existing team

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Set-VcTeam -ID 'MyTeam' -UserMatchingRule @{'ClaimName'='MyClaim';'Operator'='equals';'ClaimValue'='matchme'}

Replace a teams user matching rules

docs.title: EXAMPLE 4
docs.text:
Set-VcTeam -ID 'MyTeam' -UserMatchingRule @{'ClaimName'='MyClaim';'Operator'='equals';'ClaimValue'='matchme'} -NoOverwrite

Update a teams user matching rules, appending instead of overwriting

docs.title: EXAMPLE 5
docs.text:
Set-VcTeam -ID 'MyTeam' -Name 'ThisTeamIsBetter' -PassThru

Rename an existing team and return the updated team object

docs.title: EXAMPLE 6
docs.text:
Get-VcTeam -All | Where-Object {$_.name -like '*shouldnt be sysadmin*'} | Set-VcTeam -NewRole 'PKI Admin'

Update many teams

docs.title: -Team
docs.text:
Team ID or name

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases: teamId, ID

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Name
docs.text:
Provide a new name for the team if you wish to change it.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Role
docs.text:
Provide a new role for the team if you wish to change it. Accepted values are 'System Admin', 'PKI Admin', 'Resource Owner', or 'Guest'

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -UserMatchingRule
docs.text:
Rule(s) for user membership which matches SSO claim data. Each rule has 3 parts, ClaimName, Operator, and ClaimValue, in the form of a hashtable. A list/array of hashtables is supported. For a singlepart claim, the operator can be 'equals', 'does not equal', 'starts with', or 'ends with'. For a multivalue claim where ClaimValue will be an array, the operator can be 'contains' or 'does not contain'. ClaimName and ClaimValue are case sensitive. When providing user AD groups or other groups they are most commonly provided as multivalue claims. This parameter will overwrite existing rules by default. To append use -NoOverwrite.

Type: Hashtable[]
Parameter Sets: NoOverwrite
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Type: Hashtable[]
Parameter Sets: Overwrite
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Append to existing user matching rules as opposed to overwriting

Type: SwitchParameter

Aliases:

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Sets a value on an objects attribute or policies (policy attributes)

docs.title: NotPolicy (Default)
docs.text:
Set-VdcAttribute -Path <String> -Attribute <Hashtable> [-BypassValidation] [-NoOverwrite]
 [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: Policy
docs.text:
Set-VdcAttribute -Path <String> -Attribute <Hashtable> -Class <String> [-Lock] [-BypassValidation]
 [-NoOverwrite] [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Set the value on an objects attribute. The attribute can either be built-in or custom. You can also set policies (policy attributes).

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Set-VdcAttribute -Path '\VED\Policy\My Folder\app.company.com' -Attribute @{'Consumers'='\VED\Policy\myappobject.company.com'}

Set the value on an object

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Set-VdcAttribute -Path '\VED\Policy\My Folder\app.company.com' -Attribute @{'Management Type'=$null}

Clear the value on an object, reverting to policy if applicable

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Set-VdcAttribute -Path '\VED\Policy\My Folder\app.company.com' -Attribute @{'My custom field Label'='new custom value'}

Set the value on a custom field

docs.title: EXAMPLE 4
docs.text:
Set-VdcAttribute -Path '\VED\Policy\My Folder\app.company.com' -Attribute @{'My custom field Label'='new custom value'} -BypassValidation

Set the value on a custom field bypassing field validation

docs.title: EXAMPLE 5
docs.text:
Set-VdcAttribute -Path '\VED\Policy\My Folder' -Class 'X509 Certificate' -Attribute @{'Notification Disabled'='0'}

Set a policy attribute

docs.title: EXAMPLE 6
docs.text:
Set-VdcAttribute -Path '\VED\Policy\My Folder' -Class 'X509 Certificate' -Attribute @{'Notification Disabled'='0'} -Lock

Set a policy attribute and lock the value

docs.title: EXAMPLE 7
docs.text:
Set-VdcAttribute -Path '\VED\Policy\app.company.com' -Attribute @{'X509 SubjectAltName IPAddress'='1.2.3.4'; 'X509 SubjectAltName DNS'='me.x.com'}

Update SAN field(s). The SAN key names are: - X509 SubjectAltName DNS - X509 SubjectAltName IPAddress - X509 SubjectAltName OtherName UPN - X509 SubjectAltName RFC822 - X509 SubjectAltName URI

docs.title: -Path
docs.text:
Path to the object to modify

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases: DN

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Attribute
docs.text:
Hashtable with names and values to be set. If setting a custom field, you can use either the name or guid as the key. If using a custom field name, you must have created a session with New-VenafiSession and not just a TLSPDC token. To clear a value overwriting policy, set the value to $null.

Type: Hashtable
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Class
docs.text:
Required when setting policy attributes. Provide the class name to set the value for. If unsure of the class name, add the value through the TLSPDC UI and go to Support->Policy Attributes to find it.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: Policy
Aliases: ClassName, PolicyClass

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Lock the value on the policy. Only applicable to setting policies.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: Policy
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -BypassValidation

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -NoOverwrite
docs.text:
Add to any existing value, if there is one, as opposed to overwriting. Unlike overwriting, adding can only be a single value, not an array. Not applicable to custom fields.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS

 [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.text:

 [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: Certificate
docs.text:
Set-VdcCredential -Path <String> -Password <PSObject> -Certificate <X509Certificate2> [-Expiration <DateTime>]
 [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: UsernamePassword
docs.text:

 [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

 [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

Set-VdcCredential -Path <String> -Value <Hashtable> [-VenafiSession <PSObject>]
 [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Update values for credential objects in TLSPDC.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Set-VdcCredential -Path '\VED\Policy\Password Credential' -Password 'my-new-password'

Set a new password for a password credential

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Set-VdcCredential -Path '\VED\Policy\UsernamePassword Credential' -Password 'my-new-password' -Username 'greg'

Set a new password for a username/password credential

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Set-VdcCredential -Path '\VED\Policy\Certificate Credential' -Password 'my-pk-password' -Certificate $p12

Set a new certificate for a certificate credential

docs.title: EXAMPLE 4
docs.text:
Set-VdcCredential -Path '\VED\Policy\Password Credential' -Password 'my-new-password' -Expiration (Get-Date).AddDays(30)

Set a new password for a password credential and set the expiration date to 30 days from now

docs.title: EXAMPLE 5
docs.text:
Set-VdcCredential -Path '\VED\Policy\Certificate Credential' -CertificateLinkPath '\VED\Policy\Certificates\newcert.domain.com'

Set an existing TLSPDC certificate object as the certificate for a certificate credential

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Set explicit permissions for TLSPDC objects

docs.title: PermissionObjectGuid (Default)
docs.text:
Set-VdcPermission -Guid <Guid> -IdentityId <String> -Permission <TppPermission> [-Force]
 [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: PermissionPath
docs.text:
Set-VdcPermission -Path <String> -IdentityId <String> [-IsAssociateAllowed] [-IsCreateAllowed]
 [-IsDeleteAllowed] [-IsManagePermissionsAllowed] [-IsPolicyWriteAllowed] [-IsPrivateKeyReadAllowed]
 [-IsPrivateKeyWriteAllowed] [-IsReadAllowed] [-IsRenameAllowed] [-IsRevokeAllowed] [-IsViewAllowed]
 [-IsWriteAllowed] [-Force] [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf]
 [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: PermissionObjectPath
docs.text:
Set-VdcPermission -Path <String> -IdentityId <String> -Permission <TppPermission> [-Force]
 [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: PermissionGuid
docs.text:
Set-VdcPermission -Guid <Guid> -IdentityId <String> [-IsAssociateAllowed] [-IsCreateAllowed] [-IsDeleteAllowed]
 [-IsManagePermissionsAllowed] [-IsPolicyWriteAllowed] [-IsPrivateKeyReadAllowed] [-IsPrivateKeyWriteAllowed]
 [-IsReadAllowed] [-IsRenameAllowed] [-IsRevokeAllowed] [-IsViewAllowed] [-IsWriteAllowed] [-Force]
 [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Adds, modifies, or removes explicit permissions on TLSPDC objects. You can provide a complete permission object or modify individual permissions.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Set-VdcPermission -Guid '1234abcd-g6g6-h7h7-faaf-f50cd6610cba' -IdentityId 'AD+mydomain.com:azsxdcfvgbhnjmlk09877654321' -Permission $TppPermObject

Permission a user/group on an object specified by guid

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Set-VdcPermission -Path '\ved\policy\my folder' -IdentityId 'AD+mydomain.com:azsxdcfvgbhnjmlk09877654321' -Permission $TppPermObject

Permission a user/group on an object specified by path

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Get-VdcPermission -Path '\ved\policy\my folder' -IdentityId 'AD+mydomain.com:azsxdcfvgbhnjmlk09877654321' -Explicit | Set-VdcPermission -IdentityId $newId

Permission a user/group based on permissions of an existing user/group

docs.title: EXAMPLE 4
docs.text:
Get-VdcPermission -Path '\ved\policy\my folder' -IdentityId 'AD+mydomain.com:azsxdcfvgbhnjmlk09877654321' -Explicit | Set-VdcPermission -IsWriteAllowed

Add specific permission(s) for a specific user/group associated with an object

docs.title: EXAMPLE 5
docs.text:
Get-VdcPermission -Path '\ved\policy\my folder' -Explicit | Set-VdcPermission -IsAssociateAllowed -IsWriteAllowed

Add specific permission(s) for all existing user/group associated with an object

docs.title: EXAMPLE 6
docs.text:
Get-VdcPermission -Path '\ved\policy\my folder' -Explicit | Set-VdcPermission -IsAssociateAllowed:$false

Remove specific permission(s) for all existing user/group associated with an object

docs.title: EXAMPLE 7
docs.text:
$id = Find-VdcIdentity -Name 'brownstein' | Select-Object -ExpandProperty Id
Find-VdcObject -Path '\VED' -Recursive | Get-VdcPermission -IdentityId $id | Set-VdcPermission -Permission $TppPermObject -Force

Reset permissions for a specific user/group for all objects. Note the use of -Force to overwrite existing permissions.

docs.text:
Path to an object

Parameter Sets: PermissionPath, PermissionObjectPath
Aliases: DN

Default value: None

docs.title: -IsAssociateAllowed
docs.text:
Associate or disassociate an Application and Device object with a certificate. Push the certificate and private key to the Application object. Retry the certificate installation.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: PermissionPath, PermissionGuid
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -IsCreateAllowed
docs.text:
The caller can create subordinate objects, such as Devices and Applications. Create permission grants implicit View permission.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: PermissionPath, PermissionGuid
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -IsDeleteAllowed
docs.text:
The caller can delete objects.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: PermissionPath, PermissionGuid
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -IsManagePermissionsAllowed
docs.text:
The caller can grant other user or group Identities permission to the current object or subordinate objects.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: PermissionPath, PermissionGuid
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -IsPolicyWriteAllowed
docs.text:
The caller can modify policy values on folders. Also requires View permission. Manage Policy permission grants implicit Read permission and Write permission.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: PermissionPath, PermissionGuid
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -IsPrivateKeyReadAllowed
docs.text:
The caller can download the private key for Policy and Certificate objects.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: PermissionPath, PermissionGuid
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -IsPrivateKeyWriteAllowed
docs.text:
The caller can upload the private key for Policy, Certificate, and Private Key Credential objects to Trust Protection Platform.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: PermissionPath, PermissionGuid
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -IsReadAllowed
docs.text:
The caller can view and read object data from the Policy tree. However, to view subordinate objects, View permission or higher permissions is also required.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: PermissionPath, PermissionGuid
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -IsRenameAllowed
docs.text:
The caller can rename and move Policy tree objects. Move capability also requires Rename permission to the object and Create permission to the target folder.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: PermissionPath, PermissionGuid
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -IsRevokeAllowed
docs.text:
The caller can invalidate a certificate. Also requires Write permission to the certificate.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: PermissionPath, PermissionGuid
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -IsViewAllowed
docs.text:
The caller can confirm that the object is present in the Policy tree.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: PermissionPath, PermissionGuid
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -IsWriteAllowed
docs.text:
The caller can edit object attributes. To move objects in the tree, the caller must have Write permission to the objects and Create permission to the target folder. Write permission grants implicit Read permission.

Type: SwitchParameter
Parameter Sets: PermissionPath, PermissionGuid
Aliases:

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: False
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -Force

When setting a TppPermission object with -Permission and one already exists, use this to overwrite

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Set workflow ticket status

docs.title: SYNTAX

 [[-ScheduledStart] <DateTime>] [[-ScheduledStop] <DateTime>] [[-VenafiSession] <PSObject>]
 [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Get-VdcWorkflowTicket -Path '\VED\policy\myapp.company.com' | Set-VdcWorkflowTicketStatus -Status Approved
Approve all tickets for a certificate

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Get-VdcWorkflowTicket -Path '\VED\policy\myapp.company.com' | Set-VdcWorkflowTicketStatus -Status 'Approved After' -ScheduledStart (Get-Date).AaaDays(3) -Explanation 'weekend upgrade'

docs.text:
Test-VdcObject -Path <String[]> [-ExistOnly] [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: GUID
docs.text:
Test-VdcObject -Guid <Guid[]> [-ExistOnly] [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Provided with either a DN path or GUID, find out if an object exists.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
$multDNs | Test-VdcObject
Object                    Exists
--------                  -----
\VED\Policy\My folder1    True
\VED\Policy\My folder2    False

Test for existence by Path

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
Test-VdcObject -Path '\VED\Policy\My folder' -ExistOnly

Retrieve existence for only one object

docs.title: -Path
docs.text:
DN path to object. Provide either this or Guid. This is the default if both are provided.

Type: String[]
Parameter Sets: DN
Aliases: DN

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName, ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

Guid which represents a unqiue object. Provide either this or Path.

Type: Guid[]
Parameter Sets: GUID
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByPropertyName)
Accept wildcard characters: False

Only return boolean instead of Object and Exists list. Helpful when validating just 1 object.

Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Test if a TLSPDC token is valid

docs.title: Session (Default)
docs.text:
Test-VdcToken [-GrantDetail] [-VenafiSession <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: VaultAccessToken
docs.text:
Test-VdcToken [-AuthServer <String>] -VaultAccessTokenName <String> [-GrantDetail]
 [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: AccessToken
docs.text:
Test-VdcToken -AuthServer <String> -AccessToken <PSObject> [-GrantDetail] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: VenafiPsToken
docs.text:
Test-VdcToken -VenafiPsToken <PSObject> [-GrantDetail] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Use the TLSPDC API call 'Authorize/Verify' to test if the current token is valid.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Test-VdcToken
Verify that accesstoken stored in $VenafiSession object is valid.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 2
docs.text:
$VenafiPsToken | Test-VdcToken
Verify that token object from pipeline is valid. Can be used to validate directly object from New-VdcToken.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 3
docs.text:
Test-VdcToken -AuthServer venafi.mycompany.com -AccessToken $cred
Verify that PsCredential object containing accesstoken is valid.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 4
docs.text:
Test-VdcToken -VaultAccessTokenName access-token
Verify access token stored in VenafiPS vault, metadata stored with secret

docs.title: EXAMPLE 5
docs.text:
Test-VdcToken -VaultAccessTokenName access-token -AuthServer venafi.mycompany.com
Verify access token stored in VenafiPS vault providing server to authenticate against

docs.title: EXAMPLE 6
docs.text:
Test-VdcToken -GrantDetail
Verify that accesstoken stored in $VenafiSession object is valid and return PsCustomObject as output with details.

docs.title: -AuthServer
docs.text:
Auth server or url, venafi.company.com or https://venafi.company.com. This will be used to access vedauth for token-based authentication. If just the server name is provided, https:// will be appended.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: VaultAccessToken
Aliases: Server

Required: False
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

Type: String
Parameter Sets: AccessToken
Aliases: Server

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -AccessToken

Access token retrieved outside this module. You can either provide a String, SecureString, or PSCredential. If providing a credential, the username is not used.

Type: PSObject

Aliases:

Required: True
Position: Named
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: True (ByValue)
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: SYNOPSIS
docs.text: Write entries to the TLSPDC log

docs.title: SYNTAX
docs.text:
Write-VdcLog [-CustomEventGroup] <String> [-EventId] <String> [-Component] <String>
 [[-Severity] <TppEventSeverity>] [[-SourceIp] <IPAddress>] [[-ComponentID] <Int32>]
 [[-ComponentSubsystem] <String>] [[-Text1] <String>] [[-Text2] <String>] [[-Value1] <Int32>]
 [[-Value2] <Int32>] [[-VenafiSession] <PSObject>] [-ProgressAction <ActionPreference>] [-WhatIf] [-Confirm]
 [<CommonParameters>]

docs.title: DESCRIPTION
docs.text: Write entries to the log for custom event groups. It is not permitted to write to the default log. Ensure the group and event id are correct as the api will not fail if incorrect.

docs.title: EXAMPLE 1
docs.text:
Write-VdcLog -CustomEventGroup '0200' -EventId '0001' -Component '\ved\policy\mycert.com'
Log an event to a custom group

docs.title: -CustomEventGroup
docs.text:
ID containing hex values between 0100-0299 referring to the created custom group.

Type: String
Parameter Sets: (All)
Aliases:

Required: True
Position: 1
Default value: None
Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False

docs.title: -EventId
docs.text:
Event ID from within the EventGroup provided, a 4 character hex value. Only provide the 4 character event id, do not precede with group ID.

Parameter Sets: (All)

Required: True

Accept pipeline input: False
Accept wildcard characters: False
